Management of abruptio placentae 
• Abruptio placentae is strongly associated with pre-eclampsia: the blood pressure may be low due to the
presence of clinical shock and there will be tachycardia, but hypertension may manifest as soon as the patient
is resuscitated.
• Proteinuria may be an indicator of underlying pre-eclampsia with abruptio placentae.
